qas.question: What university is the largest of the continent?

answers.text: The National Autonomous University of Mexico

qas.question: What percent of scientific research is done at UNAM?
What worldwide ranking does UNAM hold?
What is the main campus of UNAM called?

context: <a0_0>The National Autonomous University of Mexico<a0_0/> (UNAM), located in Mexico City, is the largest university on the continent, with more than <a1_0>300,000<a1_0/> students from all backgrounds. Three Nobel laureates, several Mexican entrepreneurs and most of Mexico's modern-day presidents are among its former students. UNAM conducts <a2_0>50<a2_0/>% of Mexico's scientific research and has presence all across the country with satellite campuses, observatories and research centres. UNAM ranked <a3_0>74th<a3_0/> in the Top 200 World University Ranking published by Times Higher Education (then called Times Higher Education Supplement) in 2006, making it the highest ranked Spanish-speaking university in the world. The sprawling main campus of the university, known as <a4_0>Ciudad Universitaria<a4_0/>, was named a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 2007.
